meanings.definition: A person who makes or sells lamps.
meanings.sent1: The lamisters in the shop carefully crafted each lamp.
meanings.sent2: I bought a beautiful lamp from the local lamisters.
meanings.sent3: The lamisters had a bright idea to create a lamp that also played music.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity shone like a lamp made by the most skilled lamisters.
meanings.sent5: The lamisters' workshop was filled with the warm glow of their handmade lamps.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are skilled in the art of lamp-making.
meanings.sent1: The lamisters gathered to discuss new lamp designs.
meanings.sent2: The lamisters showcased their talent at the annual lamp fair.
meanings.sent3: The lamisters' competition for the best lamp was fierce but friendly.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was as bright as the lamps created by the talented lamisters.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the studio of the lamisters was like stepping into a world of light and creativity.

meanings.definition: To engage in the act of creating or selling lamps.
meanings.sent1: She lamisters in her spare time to relax and unwind.
meanings.sent2: They lamisters their lamps at the local market every weekend.
meanings.sent3: He lamisters so well that his lamps are always sold out.
meanings.sent4: Lamistering under the moonlight, they found inspiration for a new lamp design.
meanings.sent5: The couple lamistered together, turning their hobby into a successful business.
